result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Wayne Duro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 60 days to pay or set up payment plan with COC office

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Wayne Duro

records.addlTxt:
1:17 PM Defendant Mark Wayne Duro in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Mark Wayne Duro.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.  Clerk prints the Victim Impact Statement for the defendant.  Defendant reviews the statment.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
State has complied with victim notification requirements. 

Atty Juech makes sentencign recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 26 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $200.00
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office
Initial appearance on April 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video means for Defendant Mark Wayne Duro. Defendant Mark Wayne Duro in court; in custody.
  Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states that there was a request based on 971.20.  

BY THE COURT:  Court did receive the substitution request and will grant that request.

03:39 PM Defendant Mark Wayne Duro appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
BY THE COURT:  Court previously found probable cause for Riverside purposes.
Atty Burdon requests $250 cash bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $250.00 cash bond with conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
